USA: The Mayflower, bearing some one hundred Brownist religious refugees, the Pilgrim Fathers, dropped anchor at Provincetown Harbor, north of the territory around the mouth of the Hudson River for which they had been granted a land patent. Its male passengers drafted the Mayflower Compact, a contract establishing democratic government for the Plymouth Colony and appointing John Carver (Plymouth Colony governor) its first governor.
Philippine: Colegio de San Juan de Letran established as the Colegio de Huerfanos de San Pedro y San Pablo.
Indonesia: Almost the entire native population of Banda Islands was deported, driven away, starved to death or killed in an attempt to replace them with Dutch colonial slave labour.
Diplomatic agreements in Europe commence a three-year period of cooperation between the Dutch and the English over the spice trade.
China: The Wanli Emperor's son the Taichang Emperor became emperor of the Ming dynasty.
The Taichang Emperor's young son the Tianqi Emperor became emperor of the Ming dynasty.
Belgium: First Flemish newspaper, Nieuwe Tijdinghen, begins regular publication.
Chamber of Rhetoric De Peoene hosts a rhetoric competition in Mechelen.
Barbados: English Captain Simon Gordon may have first made a brief landing on Barbados.
